sections.heading: What is a Drug License?
content: A Drug Licence is legally required to manufacture, sell, stock, distribute, or import drugs and medicines in India. It is governed by the Drugs and Cosmetics Act, 1940.

points: Pharmacies and medical stores
Wholesale drug companies
Drug manufacturing units
Distribution and stockist operations
Online pharmacies
Businesses that import drugs and cosmetics

list.title: License to Sell Drugs
points: For selling drugs directly to customers at pharmacies or medical shops

list.title: License to Sell Drugs in Bulk
points: For selling large amounts of drugs to hospitals, retailers, or other organisations

list.title: License to Make Drugs
points: For manufacturing allopathic, ayurvedic, homoeopathic, or beauty products

list.title: License to Loan Drugs
points: For making drugs in the facilities of another licensed manufacturer

list.title: License to Import Drugs
points: Required to import drugs or cosmetics into India
Proof of identity and address
Certificate of pharmacy qualification (for retail)
Letter of appointment from a registered chemist
Proof of ownership or rental agreement of premises
Plan for storage and handling
Information about refrigeration facilities
Company incorporation documents (if applicable)

sections.heading: Time and Validity
content: Processing time: Usually 20 to 45 business days depending on inspections
Validity: Varies by state, and periodic renewal is required

points: Required by law
Ensures drugs are safe and of high quality
Avoids fines, seizures, and business closure
Essential for partnerships and pharmaceutical supply chains
Helps select the correct type of licence
Assists with paperwork and inspections
Speeds up approval process
Ensures compliance from start to finish
